article: She always wore a flower in her hair.Mostly I thought it looked _ .A flower to work? But no one questioned the young woman why a flower _ her to work each day.In fact, we probably would have been more curious if she had shown up without it. She did so one day _ she delivered a project to my office."I _ there is no flower in your hair today," I said _ ."I'm so used to seeing you wear one _ it almost seems as if something is _ ." "Oh, yes," she replied quietly, in a rather sad voice.This was far from her _ bright personality.I knew l had questioned something _ than a lost flower. "Today is the anniversary of my mother's death.I _ her so much that I'm very sad.When I was a little girl, my mother would often _ flowers in my hair.But when I was 15 she died of cancer.I've just always worn a flower in my hair since then and _ made me feel as though she _ with me.Today, however, I think she would like a _ that I am becoming self-dependent, after ten years of her death.And it seems that it is the flower that has to _ ." She met my eyes and then smiled sadly."I needn't wear a flower to be _ of her.It was just an outward sign of my treasured _ they're still there even with the flower gone...Oh, here's the _ I hope it meets with your agreement." She _ me the neatly prepared document, signed with a hand-drawn flower below her name.
